openvpn.extra_config.help: For more details, see the [manual](https://community.openvpn.net/openvpn/wiki/Openvpn23ManPage) with all the available options.

openvpn.server.help: This is the basis of the IP pool which the server will allocate to clients.

openvpn.routes.description: Routes for the local routing table
openvpn.routes.help: These will be added to the local kernel's routing table and should be in the format of "192.0.2.0 255.255.255.0".

openvpn.push_routes.description: Routes to push to connecting clients
openvpn.push_routes.help: These should be in a format similar to "192.0.2.0 255.255.255.0".

openvpn.keysize.description: Size of cipher key in bits

openvpn.ca_crt.help: This should include `-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----` through `-----END CERTIFICATE-----`.

openvpn.server_crt.help: This should include `-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----` through `-----END CERTIFICATE-----`.

openvpn.server_key.help: This should include `-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----` through `-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----`.

openvpn.dh_pem.help: This should include `-----BEGIN DH PARAMETERS-----` through `-----END DH PARAMETERS-----`.

openvpn.crl_pem.help: This should inclulde `-----BEGIN X509 CRL-----` through `-----END X509 CRL-----`.

openvpn.ccd.description: A list of Client Configuration Directives
openvpn.ccd.help: This value is an array, with each client being an array whose first value is the client's common name and second value is the OpenVPN directives.

example: POSTROUTING -t nat -s 192.0.2.0/24 -d 10.10.1.0/24 -j MASQUERADE -m comment --comment 'vpn -> private lan'
POSTROUTING -t nat -s 192.0.2.0/24 -d 10.10.2.100/32 -j MASQUERADE -m comment --comment 'vpn -> internal backup server'

openvpn.client_config.description: A list of Client Configuration Connections
openvpn.client_config.help: This value is an array, with each client connection being an item.
